metadata.title: CVE-2020-25212 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A TOCTOU mismatch in the NFS client code in the Linux kernel before 5.8.3could be used by local attackers to corrupt memory or possibly haveunspecified other impact because a size check is in fs/nfs/nfs4proc.cinstead of fs/nfs/nfs4xdr.c, aka CID-b4487b935452.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-190-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-generic - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-190-lowlatency - 4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-190.220~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.82').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1098.109~14.04.1').
